title: Dante Robere 2014 Estate Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: Concentrated, jammy fruit flavors meet full body and sturdy tannins in this well-made wine. It has a large presence due to alcoholic strength and the ripe spectrum of its fruit flavors, which includes raisin, black cherry and dried fig. Yet, tannins and acidity provide a firm texture that keeps it feeling balanced.

title: David Bruce 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This Chardonnay is striking in its ability to convey marshmallow roasting over a campfire. It's full-bodied and lush, its rich fruit core of apple and pear seemingly dressed in clarified butter. That richness, however, doesn't weigh down the palate; it finishes with refinement.

title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2014 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Beautifully pure cherry notes are subdued on the nose and fight against the privations of the 2014 vintage. There is lip-smacking freshness and admirable concentration on the textured palate with its velvety folds. The finish is clean and dry. Drink now through 2019.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Muscat (Alsace)
description: Heady notes of dried Damask rose petals rise straight from the glass. The palate has the same strong aromatic impact, countered with pleasantly bitter texture. This is an unusually powerful and highly concentrated Muscat and comes with a medium body. This is best showcased next to strong cheeses. The finish is clean.

title: Casal Novo 2015 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Dusty white-fruit aromas lead to a firm palate with fine acidity, minerality and a sense of completeness. Dry slightly spicy apple and peach flavors finish in elegant form. This is everyday Godello at its best, meaning no bells and whistles, just fruit, slate and acidity.

title: Château Charmant 2016 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a stylish wine with Margaux charm, living up to its name. The acidity, finely tuned tannins and black currant fruit are all in harmony. Hold this wine until 2025.

title: Château Dassault 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Dense, dry tannins dominate this wine. It makes it hard to discern the fruit. Will it soften? Certainly, although the structure will likely remain firm.

title: Château de Côme 2014  Saint-Estèphe
description: This small property is in the same ownership as nearby Château Clauzet. The wine, half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is dense with bright black-currant flavors under the firm tannins. These and the wood-aging flavors will integrate well, giving a concentrated wine to drink from 2021.

title: Château Fleur Cardinale 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: Bold and fruity, this wine is rich with smooth tannins and a fine ripe texture. Powered by its structure and its dark fruits, it is a wine for serious aging. Drink from 2022.

title: Château la Roque de By 2016 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a firmly structured wine, dominated by solid tannins. Ample acidity and fruit concentration suggests it should age well, and be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Acacia 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine shows crisp apple and pear notes over a backdrop of minerality. Its ripe fruit is ribbed with anise, fennel and lemongrass scents.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2015 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: An aromatic hint of pine mixes with the red cherry notes on the nose, creating a very appetizing opening. The ultralight palate is translucent and slender, with the same leafy conifer aromas and lots and lots of red currant brightness and freshness. The light crunchy nature of this wine suggests that this is ideal for chilling. It's a weightless, very aromatic, and ultra-light-bodied red.

title: Alma Rosa 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tart cherry, baking spice and dried chaparral show on the nose of this appellation blend from pioneering vintner Richard Sanford and Nick de Luca, making for a soft and easy entry. It's light and refreshing on the palate, with a bit of tannic depth, offering dried cranberry, juniper and garrigue-inflected flavors. Lively and vibrant with herbal depth.

title: Ampelos 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a light, graceful red that's stemmy and fresh in a mix of well-integrated cranberry, rhubarb and cardamom flavors. An undercurrent of earthy truffle plays on the palate, weaving its way to a long finish.

title: Argentiera 2013  Bolgheri
description: A blend of predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with 10% Cabernet Franc, this opens with black-skinned berry, scorched earth and cooking spice aromas. The concentrated palate delivers black currant, mocha and licorice flavors with a hint of black pepper, all set against a backdrop of fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Avancia 2015 Cuveé de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Melony floral aromas are friendly and easygoing. On the palate, this is clean and precise, with moderate weight and a touch of oak. Lime and kiwi flavors are a bit sweet, with a welcome oaky offset. On the finish, this Godello fades nicely, with core acidity extending the ride.

title: Avignonesi 2012 Grandi Annate  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Ripe plum, coconut, vanilla and French oak aromas lead the nose. Youthfully assertive and austere, the palate offers toasted oak, licorice and espresso notes, set against a backdrop of bracing tannins that grip the finish. That structure should mellow and integrate with a few more years of bottle age.

title: Bleasdale 2013 Bremerview Shiraz (Langhorne Creek)
description: Classic hints of mint mark the black-cherry and cassis aromas of this wine. On the palate, the fruit is reasonably restrained but pure, barely touched by dried spices and cedar, then glides to a silky finish. Drink now–2020.

title: E16 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the famous Westside Road-adjacent vineyard, this Chardonnay shows a proclivity toward lush roundness of texture and tropical flourish in flavor. Vanilla nuttiness is complemented by pineapple, green apple and caramel, lasting long into the finish.

title: Dowsett Family 2015 Becklin Vineyards Georgia Rose Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This full-bodied rosé uses the 777 clone from a vineyard on the eastern edge of the Willamette valley, in an area known locally as Pete's Mountain. The Dowsett Family originally owned the Charles Coury property and started Laurel Ridge. Chris Dowsett is the winemaker at Buty as well as handling his own project. This offers a lush symphony of fruits—orange, grapefruit, pineapple and peach. It's tart, tangy, tasty and made to age for an extra year or two, in the mode of a Bandol.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2015 Bonheur Convivial Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Fresh notes of crunchy red cherry have a spicy edge of pepper. The body of this slender Pinot Noir is very light, totally peppery and very appetizing. The structure is soft and very refreshing. This could also be chilled and is a fabulously light-bodied but sprightly lunch red. The finish is perfectly dry and very enlivening.

title: Emile Beyer 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Bosc pear plays on nose and palate. The ripe and aromatic fruit is countered by ample freshness and even a little spice on the palate. There is a wonderful crispness to the body and the finish. That lasting sense of pears makes you want to sip again.

title: Enate 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Leafy gritty earthy berry aromas are spicy. This feels rugged but fresh, with a tolerable but strong tannic grip. Plum, boysenberry, chocolate, blackened toast and peppercorn flavors finish leafy, with firm tannins.

title: Fox Creek 2014 Three Blocks Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This seems a bit oaky on the nose, where scents of baking spices and cedar dominate, but those elements are balanced out on the palate, where blackberries, plums and black currants comes to the fore. This is a full-bodied, ripe-textured wine worth a look. Drink now–2025.

title: Lula 2013 Costa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Spicy, oaky and rich in flavor and texture, this wine tastes of vanilla, butter and ripe red cherries upon first sip, feels soft and easy on the palate. As it opens, more fruit and oaky spice flavors emerge, while firm tannins give it grip.

title: Marchesato degli Aleramici 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Bright red-skinned berry, new leather, herb and dark spice aromas waft out of the glass. It's medium-bodied on the palate, with star anise and tobacco notes adding depth to the fresh cherry core. Taut, refined tannins provide the framework. Drink 2018–2024.

title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Bianco Benefizio Riserva Chardonnay (Pomino)
description: Made entirely from Chardonnay, this opens with yellow apple, Williams pear and white peach aromas that follow through to the palate. It's elegant and steeped in vanilla and hazelnut flavors, with fresh acidity that lifts its creamy texture.

title: McPherson Wine Company 2014 MWC Pinot Noir (Victoria)
description: At around $20 per bottle, this is a solid Pinot Noir for the money. It's medium in body and silky in texture, with black cherry fruit and subtle shadings of iris and vanilla that ling on the finish. Drink now–2020.

title: McPherson Wine Company 2015 MWC Pinot Gris (Victoria)
description: Made with enough skin contact to yield a gentle coppery hue, this medium-bodied wine features aromas of cantaloupe, cherry and citrus. Cherry fruit on the palate is accompanied by vaguely Pinot Noir-like notes of dried bracken and moss, then glides to a long, silky finish. Drink now.

title: Joseph Cattin 2015 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Lovely notes of ripe apple with an orange peel touch play on the nose. They also appear on the dry, juicy and very fruit-driven palate. All is driven and slender, fresh but ripe. The fruit is so burgeoning that this is still juicy, even on the apple-scented finish.
